17 
18 class PoseLikelihoodServerNode:
19  """
20  This is a port of the AMR Python PoseLikelihoodServerNode
21  """
22  def __init__(self):
23 
24  rospy.init_node(NODE)
25  # Wait until SwitchRanger service (and hence stage node) becomes available.
26  rospy.loginfo('Waiting for the /switch_ranger service to be advertised...');
27  rospy.wait_for_service('/switch_ranger')
28  try:
29  switch_ranger = rospy.ServiceProxy('/switch_ranger', SwitchRanger)
30  # Make sure that the hokuyo laser is available and enable them (aka switch on range scanner)
31  switch_ranger('scan_front', True)
32  except rospy.ServiceException, e:
33  rospy.logerror("Service call failed: %s"%e)
34 
35  """
36  Expose GetMultiplePoseLikelihood Service here,
37  subscribe for /scan_front,
38  create client for /occupancy_query_server/get_nearest_occupied_point_on_beam service
39 
40  http://wiki.ros.org/ROS/Tutorials/WritingServiceClient(python)
41  """
42 
43  self._tf = tf.TransformListener()
44 
45  rospy.loginfo('Started [pose_likelihood_server] node.')
46 
47  pass
48 
49  """
50  ============================== YOUR CODE HERE ==============================
51  Instructions: implemenent the pose likelihood server node including a
52  constructor which should create all needed servers, clients,
53  and subscribers, and appropriate callback functions.
54  GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeam service allows to query
55  multiple beams in one service request. Use this feature to
56  simulate all the laser beams with one service call, otherwise
57  the time spent on communication with the server will be too
58  long.
59 
60  Hint: refer to the sources of the previous assignments or to the ROS
61  tutorials to see examples of how to create servers, clients, and
62  subscribers.
63 
64  Hint: in the laser callback it is enough to just store the incoming laser
65  readings in a class member variable so that they could be accessed
66  later while processing a service request.
67 
68  Hint: the GetNearestOccupiedPointOnBeam service may return arbitrary large
69  distance, do not forget to clamp it to [0..max_range] interval.
70 
71 
72  Look at the tf library capabilities, you might need it to find transform
73  from the /base_link to /base_laser_front_link.
74  Here's an example how to use the transform lookup:
75 
76  time = self._tf.getLatestCommonTime(frame_id, other_frame_id)
77  position, quaternion = self._tf.lookupTransform(frame_id,
78  other_frame_id,
79  time)
80  yaw = tf.transformations.euler_from_quaternion(quaternion)[2]
81  x, y, yaw = position[0], position[1], yaw
82 
83  You might need other functions for transforming routine, you can find
84  a brief api description
85  http://mirror.umd.edu/roswiki/doc/diamondback/api/tf/html/python/tf_python.html
86  """
87 
88

90  w = PoseLikelihoodServerNode()
91  rospy.spin()
